item.name: Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small
Axis & Allies
item.comment: A old favourite from high school. Hours of play fueled y coke and doritos.

item.name: Axis & Allies: Europe
item.comment: A streamlined version of the original. I quite enjoyed it despite the heavy dice rolling.

item.name: Battleship
item.comment: I find it dull but my son enjoys it.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica
item.comment: Fun game but a little fiddly and a little longer than necessary. Fun to play, great interaction.

item.name: Blokus
item.comment: fun little family game.

item.name: Blood Bowl: Team Manager – The Card Game
Blueprints
item.comment: a quick easy filler

item.name: Boggle
item.comment: A big hit with me and my wife. A fun, fastpaced word game.

item.name: Boom-O
item.comment: Repetitive but a good quick game with kids.

item.name: Candy Land
item.comment: Glad my oldest is over it and dreading the day the younger ones find it. :D

item.name: Carcassonne: 10 Year Special Edition
item.comment: The game that started me back into games.

item.name: The Castles of Burgundy
item.comment: I am sure we missed a ton of points while scoring but it was a very interesting game and I look forward to trying again.

item.name: Catan: Portable Edition
item.comment: Settlers is a great game. The travel edition is a little tough to play though.

item.name: Chaos Marauders
item.comment: I really loved this game In my late pre-teens/early teens, but it got a little repetitive.

item.name: Checkers
item.comment: Haven't played in years. Never really did it for me.

item.name: Chess
item.comment: I am no Grand Master but I like to play.

item.name: CO₂
item.comment: Love the look and play of this game.

item.name: Cranium
item.comment: a decent game for a group with varied tasted in games.

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
Discworld: Ankh-Morpork
item.comment: I really enjoyed this game. It's chaotic nature and theme really brought Discworld to life.

item.name: Dixit Odyssey
item.comment: What a great game. Excellent party game.

item.name: Dominoes
item.comment: Great game for a large group.

item.name: Eaten by Zombies!
item.comment: hard to rate this game on the first play. A little complex at first but definitely left me wanting to play again.

item.name: Eclipse
item.comment: Wow, what a game! After the rule explanation and the initial set up I was rather intimidated, expecially with the player board that seemed in great danger of a sneeze but I was surprised by how intuitive and smooth the gameplay was. A very deep game that is engaging and has little downtime.

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
A Few Acres of Snow
item.comment: Love it but no one wants to play.

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue
item.comment: Initial rating. WIll probably climb after some plays.

item.name: Forbidden Island
item.comment: What a great Co-Op game.

item.name: Friday
item.comment: Hooked me immediately. Nice solitaire game and very challenging.

item.name: A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition)
Go
item.comment: I played a ton on KGS. I prefer to play in person but hard to find players.

item.name: The Great Zimbabwe
item.comment: I am quite divided on how to rate this. On one hand I love the game and would love to play anytime but the components are so bad for such a costly game.

item.name: In the Year of the Dragon
King of New York
item.comment: A great deeper version of one of my favourite games.

item.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
Loot
item.comment: Seemed like War to me. My eight year old liked it. A decent quick card game.

item.name: Monopoly
item.comment: I finished a game once.

item.name: Monopoly: Here and Now – The World Edition
item.comment: I really dislike monopoly. The debit cards in this edition are an improvement.

item.name: Myrmes
item.comment: rating may change as the replayability of this game is iffy

item.name: Power Grid
item.comment: I was really intimidated by the rules but after 1 or 2 turns it becomes very obvious. What a great game.

item.name: The Resistance
item.comment: What a fun game. It would really depend on the people playing but it has tons of potential.

item.name: Risk
item.comment: Basic War game. Great fun.

item.name: Risk Legacy
item.comment: First 2 plays. I like the VP system and I love tearing cards.

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
item.comment: Fun game. Seemed like Yahtzee with thinking.

item.name: Rummikub
item.comment: A big hit with my wife and her dutch mother. I get beat all the time but it is fun

item.name: Samurai
item.comment: This game was alright. I would play if asked but I wouldn't ask to play.

item.name: Scrabble
item.comment: I don't like playing against 'real' Scrabble players. ;)

item.name: Skip-Bo
item.comment: A classic in our family. It comes out during the holidays.

item.name: Stone Age
item.comment: The 10 rating is based on a few early games but I already love this game. Simple mechanic that can be used to devise some pretty good strategies. I have played this with adults and my 8 year old son and both have been enjoyable.

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
Ticket to Ride
item.comment:
I enjoyed this very much. Simple enough for my son and offers enough to keep the adults interested. One play in and I am already anxious for the 1910 expansion.
Updated to a 9 after a few more plays and especially after a 5 player game.

item.name: Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 4 – Nederland
Troyes
item.comment: Interesting game. I wasn't sure what I was doing or how I was doing for the first 1/4 of the game. Not sold on it but I would give it another try

item.name: Twister
item.comment: Left foot yellow.

item.name: Undermining
item.comment:
one play in and it was a good time. My son liked it a lot.
The rules were not as clear as I would have liked but we got through it.

item.name: UNO
item.comment: Fun family game.

item.name: Wizard
item.comment: Really fun. Great game for the cottage or a filler game.

item.name: Yahtzee
item.comment: Can be fun at times but I have to be in the mood.
